summary: This document is a daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, covering three shifts on July 22, 2019. It details routine operations, inmate counts, security checks, and notes that an inmate is at a local hospice/nursing facility with USMS guards. The log is significant as it provides a record of facility operations on the day Jeffrey Epstein was in custody, though he is not explicitly named.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer responsible for the operations log during the Morning Watch shift on July 22, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: Relieved the Day Watch Operations Lieutenant at 4:00 PM on July 22, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: M/W Lieutenant
persons.context: Relieved the Evening Watch Operations Lieutenant at midnight on July 22/23, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Inmate at Medical Facility
events.description: An inmate/monitor (I/M) is noted as being at a local hospice (later specified as Goldcrest nursing facility) with US Marshals Service (USMS) guards throughout the day.

events.title: Anonymous Threat Call
events.description: NYC 311 operator reports an anonymous call stating that the 'Macballers' are planning a stabbing on unit 11 south when it opens in the morning.

events.title: Inmate Transfers and Admissions
events.description: Routine inmate movements including an inmate returning from local hospice, three inmates moved to SHU (Special Housing Unit), and new commitments processed.

events.title: Fire System Failure
events.description: The fire alarm and sprinkler system are reported as inoperable during the Day and Evening Watch shifts, requiring a Fire Watch protocol.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The log documents operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on July 22, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death.
An inmate is recorded as being at a 'local hospice' and later 'Goldcrest nursing facility' with US Marshals Service guards throughout the day.
The fire alarm and sprinkler system were reported as inoperable during the Day and Evening Watch shifts.
An anonymous threat was called in to NYC 311 about a planned stabbing on 'unit 11 south'.
The document shows routine inmate counts, security checks, and administrative procedures, providing context for the facility's operational state.
